title: Capacitors - dielectric constant from Q-vs-V graph

content.question: A parallel-plate capacitor has a dielectric material filling the space between its plates. The plates each have area <math alttext="8.5 times 10 raised to the negative 4 power meter squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>8.5</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math> and are separated by a distance of <math alttext="1.0 times 10 raised to the negative 3 power meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>. Experimental data showing the plate charge as a function of the potential difference between the plates is shown in the graph. Based on the data and on the dimensions of the capacitor, the dielectric constant of the material between the plates is most nearly

choices.label: <math alttext="6 times 10 raised to the negative 11 power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>6</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>11</mn></mrow></msup></math>
<math alttext="3 times 10 raised to the negative 9 power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>9</mn></mrow></msup></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
